task:
Implement a skill graph system for OpenClaw.

The skill graph should:
1. Use many small markdown files instead of one big SKILL.md
2. Each file has YAML frontmatter with: name, description, tags, links (to other skill files via wikilinks)
3. An index file that maps skills and their connections
4. Support progressive disclosure: scan descriptions first, then follow wikilinks for deeper context
5. Include MOCs (Maps of Content) to organize clusters of related skills

The system should be in workspace/skill-graph/ with:
- index.md (entry point listing all skills)
- skills/ folder with individual skill files
- mocs/ folder for maps of content
- A reader script that can load a skill and its transitive dependencies

This is inspired by the Zettelkasten method - atomic notes linked together.
